body_html:
My bad the correct option is --verbose_failures

On Fri, Jan 22, 2016, 8:53 AM LiLi notifications@github.com wrote:

I tried but no luck. BTW, I can't use verbose_failure with my built bazel.
Unrecognized option: --verbose_failure
lli@mobvoi-rhea-01:/jdk1.8.0_65$ /home/lli/bazel/output/bazel clean
--expunge
The 'clean' command is only supported from within a workspace.
lli@mobvoi-rhea-01:/jdk1.8.0_65$ cd
lli@mobvoi-rhea-01:$ cd tensorflow/
lli@mobvoi-rhea-01:/tensorflow$ /home/lli/bazel/output/bazel clean
--expunge
................
INFO: Starting clean (this may take a while). Consider using
--expunge_async if the clean takes more than several minutes.
lli@mobvoi-rhea-01:/tensorflow$ /home/lli/bazel/output/bazel build -c
opt --config=cuda --spawn_strategy=standalone --verbose_failure
//tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer
.............
Unrecognized option: --verbose_failure
lli@mobvoi-rhea-01:/tensorflow$ /home/lli/bazel/output/bazel build -c
opt --config=cuda --spawn_strategy=standalone
//tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer
INFO: Found 1 target...
ERROR: /home/lli/tensorflow/google/protobuf/BUILD:270:1: Linking of rule
'//google/protobuf:protoc' failed: crosstool_wrapper_driver_is_not_gcc
failed: error executing command
third_party/gpus/crosstool/clang/bin/crosstool_wrapper_driver_is_not_gcc -o
bazel-out/host/bin/google/protobuf/protoc ... (remaining 15 argument(s)
skipped): com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.BadExitStatusException:
Process exited with status 1.
/usr/bin/ld:
bazel-out/host/bin/google/protobuf/_objs/protoc/google/protobuf/src/google/protobuf/compiler/main.o:
relocation R_X86_64_32 against `.rodata.str1.1' can not be used when making
a shared object; recompile with -fPIC
bazel-out/host/bin/google/protobuf/_objs/protoc/google/protobuf/src/google/protobuf/compiler/main.o:
error adding symbols: Bad value
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
Target //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer failed to build
Use --verbose_failures to see the command lines of failed build steps.
INFO: Elapsed time: 166.539s, Critical Path: 18.48s

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
#817 (comment)
.

body:
My bad the correct option is --verbose_failures

On Fri, Jan 22, 2016, 8:53 AM LiLi notifications@github.com wrote:

> I tried but no luck. BTW, I can't use verbose_failure with my built bazel.
> Unrecognized option: --verbose_failure
> lli@mobvoi-rhea-01:~/jdk1.8.0_65$ /home/lli/bazel/output/bazel clean
> --expunge
> The 'clean' command is only supported from within a workspace.
> lli@mobvoi-rhea-01:~/jdk1.8.0_65$ cd
> lli@mobvoi-rhea-01:~$ cd tensorflow/
> lli@mobvoi-rhea-01:~/tensorflow$ /home/lli/bazel/output/bazel clean
> --expunge
> ................
> INFO: Starting clean (this may take a while). Consider using
> --expunge_async if the clean takes more than several minutes.
> lli@mobvoi-rhea-01:~/tensorflow$ /home/lli/bazel/output/bazel build -c
> opt --config=cuda --spawn_strategy=standalone --verbose_failure
> //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer
> .............
> Unrecognized option: --verbose_failure
> lli@mobvoi-rhea-01:~/tensorflow$ /home/lli/bazel/output/bazel build -c
> opt --config=cuda --spawn_strategy=standalone
> //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer
> INFO: Found 1 target...
> ERROR: /home/lli/tensorflow/google/protobuf/BUILD:270:1: Linking of rule
> '//google/protobuf:protoc' failed: crosstool_wrapper_driver_is_not_gcc
> failed: error executing command
> third_party/gpus/crosstool/clang/bin/crosstool_wrapper_driver_is_not_gcc -o
> bazel-out/host/bin/google/protobuf/protoc ... (remaining 15 argument(s)
> skipped): com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.BadExitStatusException:
> Process exited with status 1.
> /usr/bin/ld:
> bazel-out/host/bin/google/protobuf/_objs/protoc/google/protobuf/src/google/protobuf/compiler/main.o:
> relocation R_X86_64_32 against `.rodata.str1.1' can not be used when making
> a shared object; recompile with -fPIC
> bazel-out/host/bin/google/protobuf/_objs/protoc/google/protobuf/src/google/protobuf/compiler/main.o:
> error adding symbols: Bad value

> Target //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer failed to build
